intro: Valeriana oreocharis, commonly known as the mountain valerian, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Valeriana oreocharis is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
